title: Typographic Walking Tour of NYC with Tobias Frere-Jones
content:
Saturday, September 29. See links below for more info.

Via [UnBeige](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/www.mediabistro.com/unbeige/events/frerejones_announces_walking_type_tour_66724.asp),

[H&FJ](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/www.typography.com/ask/showBlog.php?blogID=10),

and [AIGA/NY](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/www.aigany.org/events/details/08AC/).
author: Ricardo Cordoba

comments.content:
Hmmm...

Is this a good excuse for missing my sisters wedding?
As Bob Dylan would say, "Don't think twice, it's alright." (But don't quote me on that, heh-heh.) ;-D

Via [UnBeige](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/www.mediabistro.com/unbeige/events/in_the_front_row_on_the_frerejones_type_tour_68232.asp), I found that Michael Surtees documented some of the walking tour on [his blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/designnotes.info/?p=1142)...
Yeah, I was stupid to go to the wedding.
No you weren't! Do you really want your sister to stop talking to you forever? ;-)

Most cool.

Will there be other type walks in NYC?

R

Russell, I have no idea if [Tobias Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tobias%20Frere-Jones) or the AIGA will be planning any more type walks, but I do know that [Paul Shaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Paul%20Shaw) does at least a couple each year through the [Type Directors Club](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041934/http:/www.tdc.org/events/education/2007classes/2007ftdcedushawwalk.html).
